name: CountMatchFilter
description: The CountMatchFilter class is a concrete implementation of GroupFilter that returns true when the number of child filters that match the given object satisfies a numeric comparison condition.
overview:
The CountMatchFilter class is a concrete implementation of GroupFilter that returns true when the number of child filters that match the given object satisfies a numeric comparison condition. This filter provides sophisticated counting logic that goes beyond simple AND/OR operations, allowing you to match based on how many filters pass.

CountMatchFilter is extremely versatile and can be used to find objects that match at least a certain number of criteria, exactly a specific number of criteria, or even objects that are "similar" to a target by matching a threshold of characteristics.

The class provides:
- Count-based matching: Matches based on how many child filters return true
- Numeric comparison: Supports all comparison operators (>, <, >=, <=, ==, !=)
- Flexible threshold: Can match based on any count condition
- Similarity detection: Excellent for finding objects that are "close enough" to a target
- Fluent interface: Methods return the CountMatchFilter instance for method chaining

Supported Operators:
- "=", "==": Equals
- "!=": Not equals
- ">": Greater than
- ">=": Greater than or equal
- "<": Less than
- "<=": Less than or equal

constructors.description: Creates a new CountMatchFilter with the specified comparison operator and target count.

parameters.name: targetCount
parameters.description: The target number of matching filters

methods.name: add
methods.description: Adds a child filter to the group. Returns this instance for method chaining.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes a child filter from the group. Returns this instance for method chaining.

methods.name: getFilters
methods.description: Returns an immutable list of all child filters.

methods.name: test
methods.description: Tests whether the number of matching child filters satisfies the comparison condition.

methods.name: and
methods.description: Combines this filter with another using AND logic.

methods.name: or
methods.description: Combines this filter with another using OR logic.

methods.name: not
methods.description: Creates a negated version of this filter.
